results.title: Ulefone CES 2024: Advance into an era of Satellite Communication and ...
results.content: Ulefone has showcased a diverse range of products at CES 2024, encompassing the flagship Armor series, mid-range Armor X series, rugged tablet Armor Pad series, and an extensive accessories ...
results.raw_content:
Ulefone CES 2024: Advance into an era of Satellite Communication and All-Scenarios Imaging
The Consumer Electronics Show, or the CES, is one of the largest and most influential events in the tech industry, which typically takes place in Las Vegas. This year, the CES starts on January 9th and runs until January 12th local time. Ulefone, one of the leading rugged phone brands, is showcasing its new products and tech innovations in the big exhibition. With the theme “Advance into the era of satellite communication and all-scenarios image”, Ulefone fans and partners gathered at the event to experience firsthand the technological advancements and communicate with the brand representatives.
Look into the Ulefone Exhibition Site
Leaked pictures can provide a sneak peek into what Ulefone certainly has in store for its audience at CES. Ulefone has organized their exhibition stand at CES 2024 quite meticulously, showcasing products according to product lines and incorporating informative signs for instructions, along with the invitation for attendees to experience features like thermal imaging cameras, infrared night vision cameras, and durability tests, suggests an immersive and hands-on experience for visitors. For attendees interested in experiencing Ulefone’s products and innovations, Stand 50743 in Halls A-D is the designated location, and make sure to mark January 9th to 12th on the calendar and consider exploring the Ulefone exhibition at the event.
Ulefone 2024 New Products Unveiled
At the event, the latest launched flagship Armor 23 Ultra featured satellite messaging implies that Ulefone mobile has entering an era of satellite communication, and its all-scenarios imaging system offers marvel visions. Besides that, the future flagships of Armor 26 Ultra featuring walkie talkie and satellite message and Armor 25 Pro sporting infiRay thermal imaging appear on the stand too. These two new flagships bring the rugged phone industry to a next level.
Gizchina News of the week
Along with the newest models. Ulefone has showcased a diverse range of products at CES 2024, encompassing the flagship Armor series, mid-range Armor X series, rugged tablet Armor Pad series, and an extensive accessories ecosystem designed around Armor devices. This comprehensive display highlights Ulefone’s commitment to demonstrating their technological strength and innovative achievements across various rugged device categories.
By redefining what rugged devices can achieve, Ulefone is likely emphasizing not only durability but also cutting-edge features and capabilities. The inclusion of a wide array of products and accessories suggests a holistic approach to meeting the diverse needs of users in challenging environments.
Ulefone’s Armor 23 Ultra First Sale on AliExpress Nears its Conclusion
Currently, the Ulefone CES 2024 event has garnered significant attention, meanwhile, its exclusive AliExpress new arrival event is hot too. The first sale of the Armor 23 Ultra is rapidly approaching its end, with the limited discount offer set to conclude on January 12th at 23:59 PST. To take advantage of this exclusive offer and secure your Armor 23 Ultra, visit Ulefone’s official store on AliExpress before the sale concludes.

Chinese Smartphones / Ulefone highlights satellite communication & imaging at CES 2024
Ulefone highlights satellite communication & imaging at CES 2024
Ulefone was one of many companies to participate at this year’s Consumer Electronics Show (CES). Today is the last official day of CES in Las Vegas, and Ulefone released some information regarding its presence there.
Ulefone highlights satellite communication and all-scenario imaging at CES 2024
The company has a tagline for its CES 2024 exhibition, it used the “Advance into the era of satellite communication and all-scenario imaging” theme. In the images below the article, you can see the company’s exhibition stand on display in Las Vegas.
Plenty of Ulefone products were shown, including the newly launched Ulefone Armor 23 Ultra phone. That device features satellite messaging, and “all scenarios imaging system”. That shows Ulefone also focused on the cameras here.
Ulefone also said that two new phones are coming. The Ulefone Armor 26 Ultra with walkie-talkie and satellite messaging, and the Armor 25 Pro with infiRay thermal imaging. Both of those were shown off at the exhibition stand, and still are, until the end of the day.
Other Ulefone Armor phones were shown, including the Armor X series, and the Armor Pad series tablets. This company is, after all, well-known for its rugged devices. The vast majority of its portfolio are rugged offerings.
Ulefone’s latest flagship is now available to purchase via AliExpress, and it offers satellite communication
Ulefone announced the first sale of the Ulefone Armor 23 Ultra as well. The phone is available to purchase as we speak, and you have until the end of the day today to get a discount. Ulefone has an early bird pricing for the device.
The Ulefone Armor 23 Ultra is available via AliExpress, from the company’s official store at AliExpress. The phone is still priced at $359.99, and the purchase link is included below. You’ll also find a link with more information about the device itself down there.
Buy the Ulefone Armor 23 Ultra (AliExpress)

results.title: Big Chinese companies brighten 2024 CES - Chinadaily.com.cn
results.content: Chinese technology companies have made a prominent comeback at the 2024 Consumer Electronics Show (CES). At the world's premier tech show in Las Vegas in the United States, they are showcasing their latest achievements in cutting-edge technologies. These range from artificial intelligence, next-generation semiconductor display, autonomous ...
results.raw_content:
Big Chinese companies brighten 2024 CES
Chinese technology companies have made a prominent comeback at the 2024 Consumer Electronics Show (CES).
At the world's premier tech show in Las Vegas in the United States, they are showcasing their latest achievements in cutting-edge technologies. These range from artificial intelligence, next-generation semiconductor display, autonomous driving, robots to augmented reality.
Highlighting that China is playing an increasingly vital role in bolstering technological innovation, experts said intelligent devices powered by generative AI and the internet of things are expected to become a key growth driver for global consumer electronics industry.
According to the US Consumer Technology Association, which organizes the event, more than 4,000 enterprises from across the globe are participating in the CES, which opened on Tuesday and will conclude on Friday. Of these, 1,114 are from China and 1,201 are based in the US.
AI-powered terminal devices are attracting attention this year amid a worldwide frenzy over the ChatGPT chatbot. Chinese consumer electronics maker TCL demonstrated over 120 pieces of intelligent hardware covering quantum dot mini-LED TVs, AI processing chips, smartphones, intelligent AR goggles and vehicle-mounted display products.
The company is accelerating efforts to expand presence in North America by boosting production capacity at its Mexican factory, given that building global competitiveness has always been important for TCL.
Hisense Group, a major Chinese home appliance manufacturer, unveiled its latest ultra light-emitting diode or ULED TV and laser display technology at the CES.
David Gold, vice-president of Hisense International, said at a product launch event that display technology is widely applied in sports, education and medical fields, continuously pushing technological boundaries.
Lenovo Group Ltd, the world's largest personal computer maker, unveiled a full lineup of more than 40 new devices and solutions powered by AI at the CES. It said it believes this year will mark the advent of AI-based PCs.
Xpeng AeroHT, an affiliate of China's Xpeng Motors, showcased its pilotless flying car, an electric vertical takeoff and landing, or eVTOL, aircraft at the CES.
"Chinese tech companies are at the forefront of technological innovation globally, and actively promoting the application of AI in consumer electronics, intelligent devices and electric vehicles," said Hong Yong, a researcher at the Chinese Academy of International Trade and Economic Cooperation.
The latest technological breakthroughs made by Chinese companies in the fields of virtual reality and autonomous driving also reflect their strengths and innovative capabilities in crucial technologies, which will be conducive to industrial upgrades and boosting their own competitiveness on the global stage, Hong said.
Chinese augmented reality company Xreal showcased its latest AR-enabled innovative products by partnering with companies such as Qualcomm and BMW.
CES attendees can join a Las Vegas tour hosted by BMW, where they will have the opportunity to experience Xreal's AR glasses along the way. They can witness how in-car information, including navigation cues, hazard warnings, entertainment content and charging station details seamlessly integrate into the real environment through Xreal Air 2 glasses.
Jin Peng, co-founder of Xreal, said, "In the future world, whether it's in offices or entertainment, for mobile commuting or personal enjoyment, people will engage in work and experience life in new and creative ways."
Chinese tech companies have shown the potential to lead the industry not only in mature categories such as smartphones, but also in emerging fields such as artificial intelligence of things, AR and VR, said Pan Helin, co-director of the Digital Economy and Financial Innovation Research Center at Zhejiang University's International Business School.
Contact the writers at fanfeifei@chinadaily.com.cn
